Understate: The claim may understate the number of law enforcement officers who have died from COVID-19 by comparing it only to officers killed on patrol, without considering other causes of death.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support as it does not provide specific data or sources to back up the statement.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the higher number of law enforcement officers dying from COVID-19, such as the nature of their work and the higher risk of exposure in certain occupations within law enforcement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that being killed on patrol is the most significant cause of death for law enforcement officers, which may not be accurate.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that more law enforcement officers have died from COVID-19 than from other causes, including gunfire and car accidents, according to the National Law Enforcement Officer Memorial Fund and the Officer Down Memorial Page.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the impact of COVID-19 on law enforcement officers by comparing it to officers killed on patrol without considering other causes of death.
